item.title: Emirates introduces new premium offerings in First and Business Class
item.description: Emirates has introduced new luxury products for its First and Business Class passengers, partnering with brands like BYREDO, Bowers & Wilkins, and Bulgari to elevate the travel experience. ](https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgd9y3iVi6anaC1N4Cso7QmgPJovqGEwEKcXCffrreFoqNcy3Bnr-B79U45k6PqBzF2gV2uzc94przcIphwRp2ecePtOYdspt9-PjYc3KQTh976kDvFOItJfkbCCO02xL93YGyDNrANYHYE/s1600/Emirates+byredo+wellness.jpg) Source: Emirates. This hypoallergenic skincare line, featuring chamomile, was created specifically for Emirates and introduced initially on the airline’s new Boeing 777 suites.

item.title: Entrepreneurs in South Malaysia are receiving support from BAHTERA
item.description: The Malaysian Ministry of Finance (MoF) has revealed that the upcoming BAHTERA series will be held on October 14th and 15th at the PERSADA Convention Centre in Johor Bahru. BAHTERA aligns with the Malaysian government’s 11th Malaysia Plan to strengthen the Bumiputera economy. The event aims to equip Bumiputera entrepreneurs with valuable business insights, effective branding techniques, and relevant technology. This year, BAHTERA anticipates over 6,000 attendees. Themed Bumipreneurs of Tomorrow, BAHTERA (Southern Edition) is tailored for entrepreneurs and Bumiputera businesses in Southern Malaysia.

item.title: DED allows for the licensing of eight additional business activities
item.description: Source: DED. Bushahab. Dubai’s Department of Economic Development (DED) has expanded its list of permissible business activities, increasing the total to 2,133. This decision stems from regular feedback gathered from various industry sectors regarding local market needs and the balance of supply and demand. The goal is to simplify business operations and offer essential resources for growth. The new additions encompass several specialized activities. These include assembling industrial robots, providing tax consultancy services, printing secure documents, manufacturing scanners, collecting and transporting hazardous waste, offering health consultancy, brokering financing deals, and developing and managing applications for social media.

item.title: Vote MPLS & Ethernet for Better Bandwidth
item.description: The 2008 election season is upon us. To determine which candidates best serve your interests, we suggest considering MPLS and Ethernet for reliable bandwidth, improved performance, and reduced costs over 1-3 years. Let’s delve into their platforms to see if they deserve your vote. IP Networking is currently the leading technology. Initially confined to local offices, IP has expanded to WANs at state, regional, and national levels. Today, almost all network designs are centered around IP or Internet Protocol.

item.title: The Bleisure app emerged as the winner of the Sabre hackathon
item.description: Source: Sabre. From left: Isolda Josy and Pranay Roy, Moments; Mendis from Sabre Travel Network Asia Pacific; and Marco Angeles, Moments. A team from Singapore won the 24-hour Destination Hack: Singapore, Sabre’s inaugural Asia Pacific hackathon. Participants were tasked with designing a new technology app that could revolutionize travel – from planning and booking to the overall experience. The winning app, Moments, caters to the increasing demand for “bleisure” travel in the Asia Pacific region.

item.title: VoIP Comparison Shopping
item.description: Voice over IP (VoIP) is becoming increasingly popular for both home and business phone service. With this new technology rapidly evolving, it’s hard to keep up with the latest companies and deals. If you’re looking to switch to VoIP or simply want a better deal, you need a way to compare your options. That’s where a comparison shopping service comes in handy, allowing you to easily evaluate available services and choose the best fit.

item.title: Cut Your Telecommunications Costs 50%?
item.description: In today’s uncertain economic climate, finding cost savings is more crucial than ever. What if you could save significantly on your monthly telecom bills without compromising quality? This might be easier than you think. This article assumes your business uses at least a T1 line for phone and/or internet, which is common for most businesses beyond small offices or home setups. While many companies rely on traditional telecom providers, they may not be the most cost-effective option anymore.

item.title: Success in business relies on establishing a broad network, having a strong passion, dedicating time, and learning from numerous failures
item.description: Alex Foo, co-founder of the entrepreneur-focused psychometric profiling tool Starteur, offers three key tips for entrepreneurial success. These insights, derived from both his attendance at the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2016 (June 22-24, USA) and his personal journey as a young entrepreneur, were shared during a Shopee University session. Foo’s trip to GES 2016 was sponsored by Shopee, the e-commerce platform by Garena. This sponsorship reflects Shopee’s commitment to nurturing the next generation of Singaporean entrepreneurs.

item.title: The Global Entrepreneurship Movement was initiated in Malaysia
item.description: Source: GEM Facebook page. The Global Entrepreneurship Movement (GEM) launched officially in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia today. This non-governmental organization (NGO) aims to create a platform for entrepreneurs from various sectors like social entrepreneurship, technology, and halal to connect. “This NGO brings together community leaders from different networks who will cultivate strong partnerships for Malaysia and our entrepreneurs," shared YBhg. Tan Sri Dr Mohd Irwan Serigar Abdullah, GEM patron and Secretary General Treasury, Ministry of Finance.

item.title: Ma from Alibaba emphasizes the importance of providing additional support for young entrepreneurs and small businesses
item.description: Alibaba Group’s Executive Chairman, Jack Ma, addressed the 34 member states of the Asian Cooperation Dialogue (ACD). He urged them to implement policies and infrastructure that would empower individuals under 30 and businesses with under 30 employees. Ma believes these groups will be the driving force behind future global economic success. Speaking as both Alibaba’s Executive Chairman and the UNCTAD Special Adviser on youth entrepreneurship and small business, Ma emphasized the significance of small entities, stating that “small is beautiful” and “small is powerful.

item.title: Bookmate has teamed up with StarHub for its initial launch in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: Source: Bookmate. Pictured at the December 17 launch of Bookmate in Singapore are (from left): Simon Dunlop, Bookmate Founder, Andrew Baev, Bookmate Managing Director, and Michael Sim, StarHub Lead Futurist, i3 (Innovation, Investment, Incubation). Bookmate, a social platform for reading e-books, has launched in Singapore, its initial entry point into the Southeast Asian market. The service offers subscribers unlimited reading for a fixed monthly price, drawing from a library of over half a million e-books provided by 600 publishers.

item.title: What Makes a Great MAN
item.description: Access to Metropolitan Area Networks (MANs), previously limited to large corporations, is now feasible for small and medium-sized businesses. If your company requires communication between multiple locations within a city, a metro network might be beneficial. Metro Ethernet is the modern solution for data connections in major cities and surrounding areas. There are two main types: E-Line and E-LAN. E-Line provides a direct Ethernet connection between two points, such as a business and its data center, warehouse, factory, or branch office.

item.title: The EU-ASEAN Business Council is pleased to receive the Joint Communication on the EU-ASEAN partnership
item.description: The European Union (EU) and the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) are strengthening their ties through a Joint Communication aimed at fostering a strategic partnership. This initiative seeks to bolster cooperation across various sectors. The Joint Communication outlines several key proposals, including elevating trade relations between the two regions by pursuing an ambitious region-to-region free trade agreement. This builds upon existing bilateral agreements between the EU and individual ASEAN member states.

item.title: Do You Build Wide Area Networks?
item.description: Imagine offering your clients network installations that stretch across the city or even the entire country! You might think it’s impossible, but it’s more achievable than you think. You won’t need massive spools of wire or heavy equipment. Everything is taken care of, allowing you to focus on expanding your business and profits. This is possible due to two key advancements: the rise of Metro and Carrier Ethernet services from competitive carriers and a business model that lets you integrate these Ethernet WAN services into your network designs.

item.title: Bandwidth Windfall
item.description: When budgets are strained, expanding into new markets and generating much-needed revenue often depends on increasing Wide Area Network (WAN) bandwidth. However, more bandwidth usually means higher expenses, creating a difficult situation. It’s generally accepted that increasing bandwidth leads to increased costs. For instance, 10 Mbps will likely cost more than 1 Mbps, although there might be a volume discount. But is it possible to get more bandwidth while paying less overall?

item.title: Choose from a variety of MICE packages available in Southeast Asia
item.description: Three travel companies — Chōsen, The Slate, and Samujana — have designed productivity programs for businesses and workgroups. These programs offer a variety of environments to help teams achieve their best results. For adventure junkies Source: Chosen website. A view of Bali. Chōsen provides experiences tailored for teams that thrive on new adventures and challenges: Activities include cliff jumping, canyoning, surfing, and cooking classes. Accommodation is available at their estate in Bali and other locations, including New Zealand.

item.title: Golden Equator Consulting assists small and medium-sized enterprises and startups in advancing towards success
item.description: Golden Equator Consulting (GE Consulting), a business consultancy firm, has established a presence in Singapore to serve small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and startups in the region. Sharon Chong, CEO of GE Consulting, noted that these businesses need strategic and operational support to streamline their growth and focus on core business functions. GE Consulting offers comprehensive business consultancy services, covering areas such as business strategy, sales positioning, financial support, marketing, technology, human resources, and legal compliance.

item.title: Contract Expiration Means Opportunity
item.description: Business telecom services often come with fixed-price contracts lasting 1 to 3 years, providing price stability but limited cost-saving opportunities. However, the fear of potential price increases upon contract renewal is often overstated. In many cases, businesses can find better deals by exploring alternative providers. The misconception about limited options arises from a perceived lack of competition. While you may have negotiated what seemed like the best price at the time, there are often numerous competitive service providers not listed in traditional directories.

item.title: The Australian government, in collaboration with Microsoft and MassChallenge, aims to enhance the local startup ecosystem
item.description: The Australian government is investing A$280,000 to bring MassChallenge, a leading global startup accelerator, to Australia. The goal is to support the growth of local startups. MassChallenge, in partnership with Microsoft Australia and the Australian government, will offer resources such as idea-pitching competitions, boot camps, and mentoring to strengthen the Australian startup ecosystem. As a non-profit, equity-free accelerator, MassChallenge provides promising startups with the opportunity to compete for millions of dollars in cash awards.

item.title: MegaPath Duet Combines Voice and Data
item.description: Small and mid-sized businesses need both phone and internet services. Their phone systems often start small and expand over time, adding lines as needed. Similarly, internet service might begin with dial-up, transition to DSL, and eventually upgrade to dedicated connections for better reliability. This piecemeal approach often leads to businesses overspending on telecommunications. Optimizing these systems could potentially cut costs by up to 50%. The key to saving money is bundling services.

item.title: Some businesses are finding success with crowdfunding
item.description: Crowdfunding, particularly through platforms like Kickstarter, has proven very successful for certain entrepreneurs. The typical project presents a concept and images of the product in development and seeks funding from backers. Both entrepreneurs and their backers can be located anywhere globally. Funding is usually sought through tiered pledges, where higher pledges receive products with additional features. This process is often gamified with “stretch goals,” where exceeding funding targets unlocks new rewards for all backers at specific milestones.

item.title: LBC 360 provides comprehensive business services in the Philippines
item.description: Source: LBC YouTube channel. In November 2014, LBC Express, the top cargo and logistics company in the Philippines, introduced a unique, fully integrated payment and logistics solution for the country. This platform, called LBC 360, aims to assist Filipino businesses of all types and sizes in overcoming supply chain obstacles. “LBC 360 is intentionally crafted to be advantageous for all business models, from physical stores to online marketplaces,” explained Miguel Camahort, LBC President and Chief Operating Officer.

item.title: The Business Plan package at The Shilla Seoul includes access to The Executive Lounge
item.description: Source: The Shilla Seoul. The Executive Lounge. Through June 30, 2019, The Shilla Seoul is offering its Business Plan package, which gives guests the opportunity to experience The Executive Lounge. Guests selecting the Executive Business Deluxe option receive exclusive access to The Executive Lounge, complimentary breakfast at The Parkview, and access to both the gym and indoor swimming pool. The Executive Lounge at The Shilla Seoul, situated on the hotel’s top floor, is designed as a luxurious penthouse.

item.title: DS3 Services Proliferate
item.description: The increasing need for bandwidth in the business world has driven the rapid expansion of high-speed voice and data services. While T1 lines were once considered high-end, businesses now have a variety of options, including various DSx copper and fiber optic connections, wireless broadband, and even point-to-point laser technology. DS3 is gaining popularity as companies find their T1 connections inadequate. Upgrading from a DS1’s 1.5 Mbps to DS3’s 45 Mbps accommodates more users and allows for dedicated internet connections.

item.title: What Replaces DSL, T1, ISDN PRI, EoC?
item.description: By: John Shepler Have you noticed that your copper-based telecom services are becoming more expensive? You might have even received a notice that your service will be discontinued. This is a growing trend as telecommunications companies phase out their old copper wire systems and replace them with newer technology like fiber optics and wireless. It’s time to think about upgrading your service. A Different Type of Copper Network The traditional analog copper telephone lines are the ones being phased out.

item.title: TalkSwitch Supports both VoIP and Legacy PBX
item.description: Choosing between a traditional phone system (analog or digital TDM PBX) and a newer VoIP system can be tough. TalkSwitch offers a solution by supporting both technologies. For example, the TalkSwitch 244vs desktop PBX handles 2 incoming lines, 4 extensions for analog phones, and features like voicemail and music on hold. It also supports 10 remote extensions, allowing cell phones, home phones, and phones on other systems to connect by dialing a 3-digit extension.

item.title: Find Metro Ethernet
item.description: Businesses currently using T1 lines for dedicated internet or point-to-point connections might be seeking ways to increase bandwidth without the high costs of upgrading to DS3 fiber optic cable. Metro Ethernet offers a solution. But how can you find it? Locating Metro Ethernet service is straightforward with the right approach. Similar to finding anything else, the key is knowing where to look. A specialized tool designed to locate and map available Ethernet bandwidth in your vicinity is essential.

item.title: Fiber Is The New Infrastructure
item.description: The current focus on infrastructure often overlooks a critical element: fiber optic broadband. While roads, bridges, and utilities are essential, fiber optic networks are the backbone of the 21st-century economy. Just as electricity revolutionized the 20th century, fiber optics will define this one. We’ve outgrown the limitations of traditional wireline systems. Fiber optic technology, with its capacity for high bandwidth, is the only way to meet the growing demand for data-intensive applications.

item.title: Kickstarter spotlight: An innovative USB cable that charges smartphones at double the speed
item.description: Minsoo and Emily Seo have developed a USB charging cable, DouBBleTime, that significantly reduces charging times for iPhones and Samsung Galaxy phones compared to standard cables. As explained on their Kickstarter page, typical USB cables attempt to communicate with the connected device while delivering limited power. In contrast, the DouBBleTime cable features a switch that prioritizes charging, effectively decreasing charging time. Source: Kickstarter. The Seos state on their Kickstarter page that a unique chip within the switch communicates with the connected computer, signaling that it only requires charging energy and not data syncing.

item.title: I Want Fiber But Not Construction Costs
item.description: By: John Shepler Fiber optic bandwidth has become the top choice for business private lines and internet connections. It offers a practically unlimited capacity with minimal latency, packet loss, and jitter. Prices are now more competitive than before, provided you don’t encounter high construction costs. Why Fiber Can Involve Construction Expenses Businesses accustomed to T1 lines, Ethernet over Copper, or business cable might be surprised by quotes that include substantial construction costs for installing a fiber line.

item.title: Singaporean companies are prioritizing cloud technology to gain a competitive edge
item.description: Source: VMware infographic. VMware, a leading company in virtualization and cloud infrastructure, recently shared the results of their vForum Singapore Business Survey. The survey shows a positive attitude toward hybrid cloud solutions, which combine public cloud services with internal cloud technology, as a method of driving growth, efficiency, and innovation. Almost every business surveyed (90%) believes that the cloud can facilitate innovation, and nearly half (44%) prefer a hybrid cloud model for their IT infrastructure.

item.title: Business sentiment in Singapore for 2017 is characterized by caution
item.description: The Singapore government has released business sentiment data for 2017, covering both the manufacturing and retail sectors. In the manufacturing sector, a survey conducted by the Singapore Economic Development Board revealed that a weighted 76% of firms expect business conditions in the first half of 2017 to remain similar to the previous quarter. While 13% anticipate improvement, 11% foresee a decline. Overall, the net weighted balance sits at 2%, indicating a slightly positive outlook for the manufacturing sector in early 2017.

item.title: Dark Fiber Gives You Control
item.description: By: John Shepler Increasing bandwidth requirements are a trend in business IT, impacting local networks and leased lines for broader areas. Beyond just bandwidth, factors like latency, packet loss, and jitter are equally crucial. Security remains paramount, while agility in making changes and deploying resources is key for operational smoothness. High Bandwidth Demands Necessitate Robust Infrastructure The need for greater bandwidth has driven a shift from copper to fiber optic cables.

item.title: The Women in Business Asia Pageant hosts a workshop on digital marketing
item.description: Source: Women in Business Asia Pageant Facebook page. To empower women entrepreneurs, the Women in Business Asia Pageant is holding a masterclass on digital marketing and social media strategies specifically for women in Singapore. The session, titled “Digital Marketing and Social Media Hacks for Women in Business,” will run for one hour and teach participants how to build an effective, business-oriented website designed to generate leads. Attendees will discover how to incorporate both original and curated content into their marketing plans.

item.title: Singaporean businesses looking to invest in China can gain a competitive advantage at the recently established Singapore Centre in Guangzhou
item.description: Source: Ascendas. Companies from Singapore expanding their business into China now have access to a centralized service platform with the recent launch of the Singapore Centre at the Sino-Singapore Guangzhou Knowledge City (SSGKC). Known as Singapore Centre @SSGKC (Singapore Centre), this resource hub is situated within Ascendas OneHub GKC, an all-inclusive business park located within the SSGKC. The Singapore Centre consolidates key agencies and resources from both China and Singapore to offer comprehensive assistance for Singaporean companies investing in China.

item.title: With Hosting You Get Domains
item.description: Looking for a website host? Consider this: 1&1 Web Hosting has a promotion running for summer 2009 that could potentially eliminate your hosting fees for three months. As if that weren’t enough, they’re also offering free domain names. Still not satisfied? They offer business hosting at $9.99 per month, developer hosting at $19.99 per month, and even include free software. Curious about the free software? It’s what you’ll need to build and promote your website.

item.title: Increase Your Bandwidth Beyond T1
item.description: By: John Shepler Your trusty T1 line has served you well for years, maybe even decades. You appreciate its reliability, consistent bandwidth, minimal lag, and decreasing contract prices. However, the bandwidth is becoming a constraint. While 1.5 Mbps was sufficient a decade ago, it’s no longer enough. Can you maintain T1’s performance with faster speeds? Absolutely! What Makes a Good T1 Replacement You had good reasons for choosing T1 when you signed your first contract.

item.title: XO Communications Nears Tbps National Network
item.description: Any lingering doubts about the supposed overabundance of bandwidth in the late ’90s telecom boom should be dispelled by XO Communications’ recent announcement. Despite upgrading their national backbone just last year, XO is increasing its capacity again. This upgrade will boost major coast-to-coast network routes from 400 Gbps to a staggering 800 Gbps, putting them within reach of terabit-per-second speeds. This massive capacity increase is driven by a fivefold surge in demand for high-capacity inter-city network services over the past year, according to XO.

item.title: The new executive board of the EU-ASEAN Business Council has been elected
item.description: The EU-ASEAN Business Council (EU-ABC), the leading advocate for European companies in the ASEAN region, recently selected its Executive Board for the next two years. The election took place at their annual general meeting in Hanoi, Vietnam, on June 1st. The new board members are: François Guibert, Executive Vice-President, President, Greater China and South Asia Region, STMicroelectronics (Chairman) Donald Kanak, Chairman, Prudential Corporation Asia (MNC Representative & Vice Chairman) Theodoor Bakker, Partner, ABNR Law, Indonesia; Executive Board Member, European Chamber of Commerce, Indonesia (Chamber Representative & Vice Chairman) Martin Hayes, President, Robert Bosch SEA (MNC Representative & Treasurer), and Jan B.

item.title: Wireless Business Internet Options
item.description: By: John Shepler In today’s interconnected world, businesses depend heavily on infrastructure like electricity, telephone lines, and internet connectivity, often delivered through copper cables. While electricity and landline phones are widely accessible due to national initiatives, internet availability, particularly broadband via copper or fiber optic cables, diminishes as you move away from city centers. Rural areas often lack wired internet infrastructure entirely, leaving businesses with limited choices. One option for these areas is wireless internet.

item.title: Small and medium-sized businesses in Singapore are increasingly transitioning to cloud services
item.description: Parallels, a company specializing in hosting and cloud services, has released an updated report on the Singaporean cloud market for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), called Parallels SMB Cloud Insights. This 2014 report predicts significant growth for the SMB cloud services market in Singapore, projecting it to reach S$916 million by 2017. This represents a strong three-year compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 21%. Source: Parallels. Zanni. John Zanni, Chief Marketing Officer for Service Providers at Parallels, observed that the Asia Pacific region is poised to outpace the rest of the world in cloud adoption due to its later start.

item.title: The World Bank ranks the UAE in the top 10 for enhancing the business environment
item.description: A new World Bank Group study reveals that local businesses in the Middle East have faced difficulties over the past year. While some economies, such as the UAE—one of the top 10 global improvers—enhanced their business environments, the Middle East and North Africa region saw relatively slow regulatory reform. According to Doing Business 2015: Going Beyond Efficiency, 55% of economies in the region implemented business regulatory reforms. This is comparable to 60% in East Asia and the Pacific but indicates that the reforms were limited in scope.

item.title: Landlines Flourish in Business
item.description: While consumers are rapidly switching away from landlines, they are still essential for businesses of all sizes. Why is this the case? Unlike individual consumers, businesses often have multiple employees and a central office location. These factors make landline-based PBX telephone systems, which connect to the outside world via landlines, the preferred choice for business communication. However, it’s important to note that “landline” doesn’t just mean traditional copper phone wires. Modern business landlines can include T1 lines, which combine multiple lines into a single digital cable, or SIP trunks, which use internet protocol for both voice and data transmission.

item.title: The Pro Series from HP is effective for small and medium-sized businesses
item.description: HP has introduced a new line of Pro Series desktops, notebooks, and an all-in-one (AiO) PC tailored for businesses of all sizes, particularly small- and medium-sized businesses (SMBs). Serena Yong, Managing Director of HP Singapore, highlighted the challenges faced by businesses in making technology decisions with limited budgets and IT resources. She emphasized that the HP BusinessNow program aims to provide support and access to solutions like the HP Pro Series.

item.title: The Epson WorkForce Pro WF-C869R offers a cost-effective solution for businesses
item.description: Source: Epson Singapore. The WF-C869R printer. Epson recently introduced a new printer with a Replaceable Ink Pack System (RIPS) that offers both high speed and quality while significantly reducing costs. The WorkForce Pro WF-C869R boasts a high page yield and a low cost per page, which can lead to considerable savings for businesses compared to using laser printers. The printer’s high-capacity ink packs come in two options: standard packs that yield up to 22,500 black and 22,000 color pages, and larger packs that yield up to 86,000 black and 84,000 color pages.

item.title: Luxury hotel to cater to Sydney airport guests
item.description: Accor, the largest hotel operator in Australia, will be a part of a new multi-use development project in Mascot, near the Sydney Airport. The project will include a hotel, commercial space, and retail areas. Accor signed an agreement with Goodman to oversee a 5-star hotel, named Pullman Sydney Airport, as part of a new A$100 million development. This project will also include office and retail space. Pullman, the biggest upscale hotel network in the Asia Pacific, has over 45 hotels in the area.

item.title: T1 Sales Support Services
item.description: If you’re interested in earning money by selling business voice and data services, there’s a brokerage service that can simplify the process. The VAR Network, managed by Telarus, Inc., connects telecom providers with VARs (Value Added Resellers). VARs typically represent manufacturers of business phone systems, network equipment, video conferencing tools, and similar products. They often handle both sales and service, providing clients with complete solutions and ongoing support. Many VARs, focused on hardware and software, haven’t ventured into selling telephone lines or WAN services, which are crucial for a comprehensive business solution.

item.title: Free International Phone Calls
item.description: During tough economic times, everyone appreciates a good deal, especially free offers. Phone Power is offering free international calls through 2008 to promote its competitive business and residential VoIP services. This is a great opportunity for anyone who makes a lot of international calls. Even after the promotion ends, Phone Power’s rates remain very affordable. This holiday season, you can call landlines in the following countries for free: United Kingdom (44), Spain (34), Ireland (353), Israel (972), Germany (49), Singapore (65), France (33), Denmark (45), Greece (30), Italy (39), and China (86).

item.title: Business confidence in China continues to be weak
item.description: While overall business confidence in China showed a slight improvement, activity declined in December as large companies continued to face weak demand and an uncertain business climate. According to MNI Indicators, a provider of economic data and analysis, businesses don’t anticipate significant improvement in early 2016. This is reflected in the Future Expectations Indicator, which remains close to the previous month’s low point. The MNI China Business Sentiment Indicator, a measure of current business sentiment, rose 5.

item.title: Tips for conducting business meetings in Jakarta
item.description: The World Islamic Economic Forum (WIEF), hosted by the WIEF Foundation, will take place in Jakarta, Indonesia from August 2nd to 4th this year. If you’re looking for halal dining options for business meetings during the forum, consider these suggestions: Anomali Coffee With locations throughout Jakarta and Bali, Anomali Coffee is a great choice for a business meeting. They offer high-quality coffee with a focus on flavor and aroma. Their baristas are highly skilled, and each location provides free Wi-Fi and air conditioning for guests.

item.title: Collective Works and CapitaLand are teaming up to launch a new coworking space
item.description: Artist’s impression of the new coworking space at Capital Tower, Singapore. A new high-end coworking space will be launched on the 12th floor of Singapore’s Capital Tower. This joint venture between two companies will occupy 22,000 square feet and support 250 businesses. The space is adaptable and caters to a variety of businesses, from new startups to large corporations. Technological features include secure server hosting, video conferencing, internet phone services, and fiber optic broadband internet.

item.title: Aktino Sends 90 Mbps Down Copper Line
item.description: Advancements in technology are challenging the belief that fiber optic cable is necessary for transmitting DS3 or Carrier Ethernet beyond local networks. Aktino, a company based in California, has developed carrier equipment that enhances the performance of traditional unshielded twisted pair copper loops. This technology enables the delivery of DS3 bandwidth (45 Mbps) or over 90 Mbps of Carrier Ethernet bandwidth over a CSA (Carrier Serving Area) spanning 12,000 feet. Consequently, numerous businesses and cell tower locations, previously limited in terms of connectivity, can now access high bandwidth connections.

item.title: A new tech and innovation business club has been introduced in Singapore
item.description: SPECTRUM, a curated tech and innovation business club, has been established in Singapore. The organization, co-founded by Cheryl Lee and Shirley Crystal Chua, aims to create a globally connected ecosystem for businesses seeking to expand into Asia by providing expert advice, necessary resources, and strategic networks. SPECTRUM has partnered with Golden Equator and Mistletoe to form a collaborative network of seven strategic groups: innovators, learning institutions, executors, backers, enablers, government agencies, and ecosystem builders and partners.

item.title: Genesys says that Asian businesses require a greater understanding of e-commerce
item.description: Source: Genesys. Thomassain. This year marks the first time Asia Pacific has surpassed Europe as the biggest online shopping market, according to Genesys, and this upward trend is expected to continue. The increasing accessibility of the internet, the expanding use of smartphones and tablets, and the potential of the Chinese market are all contributing to a surge in e-commerce throughout Asia. Erwann Thomassain, Head of Marketing, Asia Pacific, at Genesys, notes that by the end of 2014, business-to-consumer e-commerce sales in Asia will reach US$525 billion, representing half of all global online sales.

item.title: ASEAN releases strategic plan for the development of small and medium enterprises
item.description: Source: ASEAN Secretariat. The ASEAN Strategic Action Plan for SME Development (SAPSMED) 2016-2025 acknowledges the significant role of micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) in ASEAN’s economic growth, job creation, and women’s empowerment. The plan seeks to enhance MSME participation in an increasingly competitive market and support their expansion and progress. This plan outlines an implementation roadmap utilizing country representatives, leveraging available resources, including those from ASEAN Dialogue Partners, and incorporating regular monitoring and evaluation.

item.title: Focus of Kickstarter campaign: Sitting cross-legged on a CrossChair
item.description: Dave McClintock designed a chair that lets you comfortably rest with your legs up. Its unique design is so flexible, it even allows for the sukhasana yoga pose while seated. McClintock explained that the chair caters to millions of workers who experience fatigue, back pain, and stiff muscles from prolonged sitting. While crossing your legs can alleviate these issues, traditional office chairs lack the ergonomics. The CrossChair solves this by enabling various sitting positions, including cross-legged, promoting movement and reducing discomfort.

item.title: Singaporean businesses are feeling more optimistic than those in Hong Kong and are enjoying a superior work-life balance
item.description: While 43% of businesses in Singapore are very confident about their growth prospects this year, only 30% of businesses in Hong Kong share the same level of confidence. This year, 61% of businesses in Singapore have plans to increase their workforce, whereas only 44% in Hong Kong intend to do so. A recent report called the Compass Index, which analyzed business trends in Hong Kong and Singapore, reveals a more optimistic outlook among businesses in Singapore, with employees experiencing a better work-life balance than their counterparts in Hong Kong.

item.title: Telepresence as a Service
item.description: Think of telepresence as the next step beyond the telephone and television: instead of sending your voice or an image, you’re projecting your presence across distances. While not as futuristic as Star Trek’s transporter, it’s a powerful tool for businesses, especially now that companies like Cisco and AT&T offer it as a more accessible service. This shift could mark a significant increase in the use of virtual meetings. Telepresence evolved from video conferencing, which a decade ago was clunky and unreliable.

item.title: Covad Lets T1 Lines Go Wireless
item.description: While T1 lines are currently the standard for dedicated internet and business phone service for small and medium businesses, their future might be wireless. Similar to how wireless technology changed phone service, it is now impacting broadband data delivery. Covad, a national provider of T1 and related services, is at the forefront of this change. While they offer traditional wired T1 service in most areas, they’ve deployed “T1-class wireless broadband” in some major cities using pre-WiMAX technology.

item.title: Collective Works, a coworking space located in the business district of Singapore, has been officially launched
item.description: A typical co-working space at Collective Works Capital Tower. Collective Works, the first coworking space in Singapore’s central business district, has partnered with CapitaLand to open its second location. This 22,000 square foot “office of the future,” designed for high performance, takes up the entirety of the 12th floor in the 52-story Capital Tower situated in Tanjong Pagar. Collective Works has built a reputation for its stylish design and meticulous attention to detail, including a focus on ergonomics, ambiance, lighting, and acoustic sound.

item.title: 20/20 Mbps Speed on Copper and Fiber
item.description: By: John Shepler Business broadband needs have increased steadily, driven by the shift from text-based information to multimedia and the migration of business operations to cloud services. Simple, low-speed connections are no longer sufficient, with basic internet speeds now reaching tens of Mbps. A common choice for smaller businesses and remote workers is a 20/20 Mbps connection. This speed adequately supports individual users, small teams, or retail locations while remaining affordable.

item.title: The EU-Asean Business Council has introduced a new agenda aimed at increasing trade between ASEAN and the EU
item.description: The EU-ASEAN Business Council (ABC), the leading advocate for European businesses operating in the ASEAN region, has proposed several actions to strengthen trade and investment ties between ASEAN and the EU. These recommendations were released to coincide with the 26th ASEAN Summit held in Malaysia. The Agenda for the promotion of trade and investment between ASEAN and Europe was presented to ASEAN Economic Ministers and EU Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmström on April 26 in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

item.title: Etihad transforms new aircraft into a luxurious boutique hotel experience in the sky
item.description: Etihad Airways, the national airline of the United Arab Emirates, has completely redesigned the future of air travel for first, business, and economy classes. These new designs will be featured on their Airbus A380 and Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft, which are expected to be delivered later this year. Five years in development, the airline’s design goal was to bring the personalized and exclusive experience of a luxury boutique hotel to air travel.

item.title: Is WiMAX Worth the Wait?
item.description: For years, the arrival of WiMAX, a new wireless broadband standard, has been highly anticipated. From its conceptual phase to the development of standards, equipment certification, and the launch of pilot projects, the journey of WiMAX has been closely followed. However, with its impending arrival, the question arises: will WiMAX still live up to its initial hype? WiMAX, short for Worldwide Interoperability for Microwave Access, is a globally recognized standard with potential applications in various fields such as cellular backhaul, mobile internet, business broadband, and even as a potential replacement for WiFi.

item.title: The BNI business referral system has the potential to yield significant returns
item.description: Sukri Kadola, the founder and CEO of Singapore’s Bloem Singapore, a boutique and floral design house, has taken on a new role as President of the BNI Apex chapter. This chapter is part of the BNI business network, known for its referral system. Kadola highlights the success of this system, reporting that BNI Apex has closed approximately S$6 million in business since 2012 through referrals. Source: Bloem. Kadola. Kadola emphasizes the value of BNI’s network, stating that it provides a platform for members to connect, support each other, and generate business opportunities through referrals.

item.title: Shopee Malaysia honors female entrepreneurs
item.description: Shopee, a leading mobile marketplace in Southeast Asia and Taiwan, marked International Women’s Day on March 8, 2017, by recognizing the achievements of women. This year’s International Women’s Day centers around empowering women globally and inspiring them to make bold moves. Shopee Malaysia honored this theme by highlighting the stories of women entrepreneurs who took a leap of faith to launch their own ventures. The platform’s user-friendly design, free nationwide shipping, and zero-commission fees are designed to encourage more women to tap into their potential as leaders and business owners.

item.title: Hawksford has released the latest data on new business formations in Singapore for the fourth quarter of 2015
item.description: Source: Hawksford report. Data represents the shareholder’s country of origin. Although the final quarter of 2015 saw a decrease in new Singaporean company formations compared to the previous quarter and the same period last year, international investors continue to set up companies and subsidiaries in Singapore, according to Hawksford, a provider of corporate, private client, and fund administration services. Hawksford notes this decline is typical for the fourth quarter. Private limited companies made up the largest portion of new formations at 48.

item.title: The recipients of the MRM Business Award and MRM Business Innovation Award have been revealed
item.description: Source: Dubai Chamber. HH Sheikh Ahmed Al Maktoum acknowledged the recipients of the 10th Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum (MRM) Business Award and the 2nd MRM Business Innovation Award in Dubai, UAE. Sheikh Ahmed bin Saeed Al Maktoum, President of Dubai Civil Aviation Authority, as well as Chairman & Chief Executive of the Emirates Airline & Group, presided over the ceremony, which was held under the patronage of Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Vice-President and Prime Minister of the UAE and Ruler of Dubai, and organized by the Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

item.title: Cheapest T1 On The Block
item.description: You might think T1 lines are too expensive for your business, but that’s not always true. Let’s explore why. Originally, T1 lines weren’t meant for businesses. Telephone companies developed this “T-carrier” technology for themselves. However, as the internet grew, so did the need for robust digital communication, which T-carrier services like T1 and DS3 could provide. Initially, only large corporations used T1 lines because they could easily afford the high cost.

item.title: Singapore is ranked third in the Asia-Pacific region for promoting the growth of women entrepreneurs
item.description: Source: Dell. Post-it notes show challenges facing women in the workplace. • Out of the top cities in the Asia Pacific region, Singapore ranks third behind Sydney and Melbourne, Australia, in Dell’s yearly Women Entrepreneur Cities (WE Cities) Index, which analyzes cities’ ability to support women entrepreneurs. • Since 2017, all 50 cities included in the study have demonstrated year-over-year progress in the majority of the evaluated areas. Cities in the Asia Pacific region are keeping pace with global improvements, demonstrating the most significant growth in the Talent area.

item.title: Labuan IBFC places a strong emphasis on ensuring compliance and transparency in all business activities
item.description: Following the release of the Panama Papers, the Labuan International Business and Financial Centre (Labuan IBFC) has reaffirmed its commitment to facilitating cross-border trade and investment, especially within the ASEAN region. The organization emphasizes its dedication to maintaining strict transparency and regulatory standards for all business activities conducted within the centre. In a statement, the organization highlighted its continuous efforts to strengthen its regulatory framework and supervisory system. These efforts aim to meet international standards and practices related to transparency and regulatory compliance.

item.title: Know the Lingo to Save Money
item.description: To succeed with technology, you need to understand the terminology. This is especially true for VoIP telephony, where “Lingo” can refer to both the industry jargon and a specific company. Lingo, the company, offers broadband phone services for residential and business users. These services provide significant cost savings compared to traditional landlines, especially for international calls from the US. Residential plans include options like Chatter Box, Global Gabber, and Lingo Link, each with unique features and pricing.

item.title: Companies that experience data breaches in the Asia Pacific region are unlikely to be forgiven
item.description: New research from SafeNet reveals that data breaches significantly influence customer trust. The global study, including participants from Japan and Australia, found that 65% wouldn’t patronize a business that experienced a financial data breach, compromising credit card details, bank accounts, or login credentials. SafeNet’s Q2 Breach Level Index reported 237 data breaches from April to June 2014, exposing over 175 million records globally. These findings highlight the impact of data breaches on customer loyalty and revenue.

item.title: Colocation Hosting vs Cloud Data Centers
item.description: By: John Shepler You’ve been managing your own data center for a long time, but your company is expanding, and your server room can no longer keep up. Now you have a decision to make: either rent more space for the extra servers, storage, and other equipment, or think about migrating everything to the cloud. It’s a major choice that demands serious thought before any money is spent. Isn’t Everyone in the Cloud?

item.title: FEH has announced a partnership with SIA's HighFlyer business travel program
item.description: Source: FEH. The Clan Hotel Singapore lobby. Far East Hospitality (FEH) is the first hotel group to join Singapore Airlines’ (SIA’s) corporate travel program, HighFlyer. Companies in this program receive discounted airfares and earn HighFlyer points when their staff travel for business. These points can be redeemed for future travel, benefits for their business, or rewards for their traveling employees. Members of HighFlyer can now accumulate up to 500 points when their employees stay at participating Far East Hospitality hotels in Singapore, Japan, and Malaysia.

item.title: HP's Elite business PCs excel in performance, productivity, and security
item.description: HP has introduced its latest Elite business PCs, including the exceptionally thin and light HP EliteBook 705 series, an all-in-one (AiO) model, and a refreshed desktop lineup featuring the world’s smallest business-class desktop. Serena Yong, Managing Director of HP Singapore, highlighted the demand for high-end Elite notebook innovation to be extended to a wider range of employees and devices. HP’s response is the Elite 705 and 800 Series PCs, which bring sleek design, enhanced collaboration features, and robust security to mainstream business devices.

item.title: CEOs express optimism about the global economy, according to PwC
item.description: Global business leaders are feeling positive about the economic climate in the near future, according to the 21st annual survey of CEOs conducted by PwC. The survey, which included approximately 1,300 CEOs from around the world, was released at the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting in Davos, Switzerland. A significant majority (57%) of CEOs believe that global economic growth will improve in the next year. This represents a substantial increase from last year’s 29% and marks the largest surge in positive sentiment since PwC began tracking global growth projections in 2012.

item.title: Find joy through organizing your business travel
item.description: Source: SAP Concur. View from a plane window. SAP Concur draws parallels between decluttering and business travel, suggesting innovative ways to improve efficiency for travelers. Andy Watson, SVP and GM for Asia Pacific Japan and Greater China at SAP Concur, believes that just as a messy home can be transformed into a joyful space, technology can turn the often-dreaded experience of business travel into something enjoyable. Traditionally, business travelers face several time-consuming tasks: manually searching and booking flights and accommodations, organizing multiple bookings, obtaining internal trip approvals, managing paper receipts, and manually filing expense claims upon return.

item.title: Small and medium-sized businesses in the Asia-Pacific region are feeling positive about their recovery following the COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: A recent HP study titled “Survival to Revival” surveyed small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) in the Asia-Pacific region and found that over half believe they will not only survive the pandemic but thrive in its aftermath. Digital transformation is considered a key factor in this recovery. The study revealed that 60% of respondents view digital transformation as crucial, particularly in areas like innovative work processes, flexible work arrangements, and tailored products and services.

item.title: Covad Ethernet Now Cheaper Than T1
item.description: Prepare to be surprised! Covad is now offering Ethernet bandwidth at prices even lower than T1 solutions of comparable speeds. That’s right, the tide has turned, and Ethernet is now a more budget-friendly option. While this is an initial launch in 12 markets across California, Michigan, Minnesota, Pennsylvania, and Texas, it could be a sign of a nationwide shift in telecommunication pricing. To see if your location qualifies, you can check Ethernet availability online.

item.title: Two Internet Connections For Consistent Phone Calls
item.description: The way businesses use phone systems is evolving. Traditional analog and PBX systems are being replaced by mobile, computer-integrated, and cloud-based solutions. While these new features offer significant advantages, maintaining high-quality, reliable voice communication is crucial. The challenge lies in leveraging advanced technologies without compromising service quality, a balance we must strike as there’s no turning back from this technological evolution. Staying with outdated analog or ISDN PRI systems is no longer sustainable.

item.title: ERC has opened a co-working space in multiple cities across Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam
item.description: The University Mentorship program will connect lecturers with the BIG Work community to offer guidance. Users can utilize ERC’s expertise in various business areas and schedule consultations with program managers and resource advisors Guests at the BIG Hotel, catering to international and startup business travelers, will have early access to new hospitality-related products and services for research. Entrepreneur Resource Centre Holdings (ERC) has launched BIG Work, a new co-working space with locations in Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam.

item.title: Investors are increasingly optimistic about placing foreign direct investment in Singapore
item.description: Singapore achieved a top-ten ranking in the 2016 AT Kearney Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) Confidence Index. The city-state climbed five positions, representing the most significant advancement in the rankings, securing the 10th spot. This index provides a future-oriented assessment of how political, economic, and regulatory shifts are likely to influence FDI inflows into various countries in the coming years. Since its inception in 1998, the study has consistently identified the preferred global destinations for FDI, with the index rankings closely mirroring actual global FDI inflows.

item.title: Exploration of business systems in Asia
item.description: Source: OUP. “The Oxford Handbook of Asian Business Systems”, edited by Michael Witt and Gordon Redding, is the first publication to examine business systems from India to Japan. Oxford University Press, the book’s publisher, states that existing research on “varieties of capitalism” (VOC) and “comparative business systems” heavily emphasizes Europe, Japan, and Anglo-Saxon countries. This book is the first to offer a thorough analysis of the institutional frameworks of most Asian countries and assess the applicability of current theories within the Asian context.

item.title: T1 Line as an On Ramp
item.description: You might know about T1 lines as dedicated connections for digital data or PBX phone lines, but they also serve as excellent access points for various other services. Let’s explore why. Most businesses maintain a Local Area Network (LAN) and a Wide Area Network (WAN) to connect with the wider world. Your WAN connection often acts as an entry point to larger public or private networks. A prime example is “T1 dedicated Internet.

item.title: Got a Bandwidth Jones
item.description: There’s no limit to how much bandwidth we need, similar to how we always desire more money, health, or chocolate. As we gain more bandwidth, we discover new ways to utilize it. The most sought-after types are wireless, offering flexibility, and fiber optic, providing high capacity. Property owners who provide both to their business tenants might find their properties more appealing than those offering health, wealth, or even delicious chocolate.

item.title: IMDA collaborates with telecommunications companies and financial institutions to assist small and medium-sized enterprises
item.description: Seven partnerships between the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA), telecommunications companies, and financial institutions aim to accelerate the adoption of digital technologies by small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). These partnerships will focus on providing SMEs with access to pre-approved, secure, and interoperable solutions in cybersecurity and data analytics. Launched in 2017, the SMEs Go Digital program helps SMEs adopt appropriate digital technologies at each stage of their growth. SMEs are a significant part of Singapore’s economy, contributing to roughly 50% of its gross domestic product and employing two-thirds of its workforce.

item.title: What Becomes Of The Broken Hardware?
item.description: _While troubleshooting a LAN for faulty wiring, I’m haunted by thoughts of server failures. The concept of uptime seems like a cruel joke, and I’m desperate for a solution. What happens to malfunctioning equipment that dies prematurely? I need to determine the root cause of this outage. The list of underlying issues is extensive, and the network is collapsing. The pressure mounts daily, becoming unbearable. I examine server logs, looking for answers while facing the frustrated stares of the staff who demand updates.

item.title: The First and Business Class Lounge at Abu Dhabi Airport Terminal 1 has been reopened by Etihad
item.description: Etihad Airways has officially reopened its First and Business Class Lounge at Abu Dhabi Airport’s Terminal 1 after a complete renovation. The improved lounge, open around the clock, spans over 1,044 square meters and can accommodate 134 guests. This updated space in Terminal 1 provides a variety of amenities to meet the needs of modern business and leisure travelers. Mirroring the lounge in Terminal 3, the refurbished facility features comfortable seating, a designated dining area, modern business facilities, complimentary Wi-Fi, USB charging ports, restrooms with shower facilities, and a children’s play area.

item.title: Cash In With Custom Toll Free Numbers
item.description: The most valuable asset for many businesses, besides their employees, is their toll-free number. A toll-free number’s value comes from the investment in advertising and effort to link it to the business. Catchy, memorable numbers advertised across different media become synonymous with the brand. Examples like 1-800-flowers, 1-800-contacts, and 1-800-petmeds show how effective this is, even boosting online visibility as top search results. Consider your own business: do customers have an easy, memorable way to reach you?

item.title: du offers corporate mobile plans for SMEs in the UAE
item.description: Du offers five corporate mobile plans designed for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). These plans include data and free calls to colleagues within the business. Ranging from AED 50 to AED 450 per month, the plans provide data, national calling minutes, national text messages, and free calls to numbers within a designated ‘business calling circle’. Three of the plans also include free international minutes and texts. Businesses can purchase additional ‘packs’ to add more minutes, texts, or members to their calling circle.

item.title: Gigabit Internet Near Your Business
item.description: By: John Shepler It’s clear that businesses today require faster internet speeds than ever before. With most businesses maintaining an online presence and those that don’t still relying on the internet for operations or providing WiFi to customers, adequate internet speed is essential. If you find your current connection lagging, a Gigabit Internet broadband upgrade could be the solution, now and in the future. Do I Really Need Gigabit Internet? The ideal internet connection is one you don’t even notice.

item.title: International SOS advises business travelers to be mindful of the risk of malaria
item.description: Source: International SOS. Fogging of an area likely to harbor malaria-carrying mosquitoes. In recognition of World Malaria Day 2023 (April 25), International SOS urged organizations to actively participate in the global push for investment, innovation, and implementation to eliminate malaria. Malaria remains a threat in over 80 countries, leading to more than 240 million infections annually, and this number is increasing, according to International SOS. The World Health Organization reports a surge of 2 million malaria cases globally in 2021 compared to 2020.

item.title: Within the next five years, one-third of young Arabs intend to launch their own businesses
item.description: According to the 2016 ASDA’A Burson-Marsteller Arab Youth Survey, over one-third of young Arabs plan to launch their own businesses within the next five years. The survey indicates that young Arabs believe governments could do more to support them, such as promoting affordable lending, enhancing training and education opportunities, and reducing bureaucratic hurdles. When asked if their generation is more likely to start businesses than previous ones, 54% agreed. GCC youth were the most optimistic at 62%, compared to 54% in North Africa and 44% in the Levant.

item.title: Foodpanda has introduced a high-end delivery service in the Central Business District of Singapore
item.description: Source: foodpanda website. In celebration of its third anniversary in Singapore, foodpanda Singapore has introduced a premium delivery service. This service includes approximately 50 restaurants and covers the central business district. It aims to serve busy professionals who want diverse food choices delivered directly to their workplaces. Launched a month after securing US$110 million in funding, this new service reflects the company’s commitment to enhancing user experience and customer service.

item.title: The Pi1M Training Programme offered by Digi provides benefits to small business owners
item.description: Source: Digi. Participants of the Pi1M Training Programme gathered for a group photo. Digi Telecommunications recently conducted a training program for community members residing near the company-managed Pusat Internet 1 Malaysia (Pi1M) centers. This tailored program reflects Digi’s commitment to fostering online entrepreneurship within its Pi1M communities. Currently, Digi manages 34 Pi1Ms across Pahang, Kelantan, Terengganu, Johor, Melaka, and Sarawak, with plans to establish 70 more centers by year’s end.

item.title: The Compass Index indicates a positive business outlook in the Asia-Pacific region
item.description: Despite a global economic downturn, the Compass Index shows optimism in the Asia Pacific (APAC) business sector, with Australian businesses reporting the highest confidence levels. However, the Index emphasizes that maintaining growth requires agility and innovation in business practices. Source: Compass Index infographic. Australia is particular optimistic on business growth. Compass Offices, a provider of Asian serviced offices, virtual offices, and meeting rooms, surveyed their global clientele for the Compass Index.

item.title: Business Intelligence Information System for sharing insights on businesses in Dubai
item.description: The Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry recently introduced the Business Intelligence Information System (BIIS), a new digital platform designed to revolutionize how business information is accessed and utilized. This initiative aligns with the UAE Vice President and Prime Minister, and Ruler of Dubai, HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum’s vision of transforming Dubai into a smart city. BIIS provides a centralized hub for users to obtain crucial information about local and international businesses, empowering companies to identify potential partners and make well-informed decisions.

item.title: HubSpot for Startups simplifies the onboarding process for new businesses
item.description: HubSpot, a company that provides marketing and sales technology, has launched a new program called HubSpot for Startups. This program is specifically designed to support startups that are working with accelerators, incubators, and entrepreneurial organizations. The program aims to help these small businesses gain momentum in their marketing and sales efforts by offering a substantial 90% discount on HubSpot’s products. These products include tools for customer relationship management (CRM), sales, and marketing.

item.title: Goodbye Frame Relay, Hello MPLS
item.description: Managing communication across multiple business locations can be challenging. While private lines offer a solution, their cost increases with the number of locations. Frame Relay, a private network solution, gained popularity for its reliability, security, and affordability. However, MPLS networks have emerged as a newer technology offering higher bandwidth and lower costs. Frame Relay bridges the gap between public switched telephone networks and dedicated private lines. It replaces physical wires with virtual circuits, eliminating the need for dedicated circuits that incur costs regardless of usage.

item.title: Labuan IBFC experienced a 12.3% increase in new company registrations in 2014
item.description: Labuan International Business and Financial Centre (Labuan IBFC), a prominent international business and financial hub in the Asia Pacific region, demonstrated strong performance across all financial sectors in 2014. These sectors include banking, insurance, leasing, wealth management, and Islamic finance, with a 12.3% rise in new company registrations compared to the previous year. The organization highlights that 70% of companies registered in Labuan IBFC come from Asia, with 57% from Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, and Thailand.

item.title: DS3 Router Included With Service
item.description: Considering upgrading your voice or data bandwidth? DS3 service offers 45 Mbps for both uploads and downloads, suitable for demanding tasks like video transfer, medical imaging, or call centers. But finding the right DS3 router for your network can feel like an added burden. Rest assured, DS3 is a well-established technology with readily available equipment and decreasing prices. As more companies switch from T1 lines to DS3 bandwidth, implementation is becoming increasingly straightforward.

item.title: World Business Class flights departing from Amsterdam on KLM will now offer meals created by renowned three-star chef Jacob Jan Boerma
item.description: Source: KLM. Boerma. Beginning October 25, 2015, KLM Royal Dutch Airlines will feature meals from three-star Michelin chef Jacob Jan Boerma in their World Business Class on flights departing from Amsterdam*. As the first chef to partner with KLM for an entire year, Boerma brings a unique touch to their in-flight dining experience. Miriam Kartman, KLM’s Executive Vice President of Inflight Services, expressed their pride in collaborating with another Michelin-starred chef.

item.title: Singapore has received the Women Entrepreneur City Blueprint
item.description: Source: Dell SlideShare. Cover slide for the deck introducing the Dell 2018 Women Entrepreneur Cities Study. At the 9th annual Dell Women Entrepreneur Network Summit (DWEN) in Toronto, Canada, Dell introduced new analytical resources for local governments and policymakers. These tools are intended to support the success of female entrepreneurs. Based on the findings of the 2017 Women Entrepreneur Cities (WE Cities) Index, Dell, in partnership with research firm IHS Markit, conducted in-depth analyses.

item.title: ACCA is sponsoring a MOOC on FutureLearn that grants learners an exemption from the F1 paper
item.description: The Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA) is breaking new ground as the first professional accountancy body to use massive open online courses (MOOCs) for professional recognition. They are partnering with FutureLearn, a UK-based social learning platform, to offer free online courses in accounting, finance, and business. This partnership aims to reach a global audience, providing valuable supplementary knowledge for professionals and introducing career paths to those new to the field.

item.title: Etihad launches exclusive city-inspired Business Class amenities
item.description: Source: Etihad Airways. Etihad Airways has introduced new limited-edition amenity kits for their Business Class travelers. This launch is a collaboration between the airline and the luxury travel brand LUXE City Guides, a company known for its sophisticated travel guides. The kits reflect Etihad Airways’ elegant brand and include in-flight amenities and natural facial products. These products were specially created by Scaramouche + Fandango, a London-based skincare and grooming company.

item.title: HP Inc. provides innovative computing solutions and designs that empower individuals to live their best life
item.description: HP is changing mobile computing with new devices designed for the “One Life” experience – a blend of work and personal life. HP recognizes that work happens everywhere with an internet connection, requiring increased collaboration. Lionel Chng, Managing Director of HP Inc. Singapore, emphasizes that millennials desire devices that are both stylish and functional, enabling creativity and secure collaboration. HP focuses on design, productivity, security, and entertainment to enhance the computing experience for both work and leisure.

item.title: MegaPath Beefs Up Last Mile Access
item.description: The main obstacle for companies aiming to boost their WAN (Wide Area Network) bandwidth is the “last mile” access problem. Although network bandwidth has become more affordable and easier to access, the final connection between a business and the carrier’s network often poses a significant challenge. Think of it this way: a superhighway might be close to your company, but if the only route to your facility is a rough, narrow road, transportation will be slow and limited.

item.title: Ultra Conference Dual Conference Calling Solution
item.description: When your teleconferencing needs expand beyond small, local groups, it’s time to explore conference call solutions. While some phone systems offer conference bridges to connect multiple phones, outsourced conferencing solutions can accommodate significantly more participants from various locations. Ultra Conference provides a robust and affordable conferencing solution suitable for a wide range of applications. It offers flexible pricing options with both fixed and per-minute rates. Training calls are a popular use for Ultra Conference.

item.title: Business Grade 4G LTE Broadband for Work at Home
item.description: By: John Shepler Suddenly, everyone is working remotely, and reliable internet access is crucial. Remote areas often lack fast, low-latency bandwidth, making work challenging. Thankfully, 4G LTE cellular broadband and high-performance modem/routers provide a quick, affordable solution without long-term contracts. Wireless: The Solution Forget about slow, expensive wired or fiber optic installations, especially for temporary setups. Wireless broadband offers a practical alternative, readily available wherever there’s a decent cell phone signal.

item.title: Iomega Zips Into Network Storage
item.description: Do you recall the Zip drive? When floppy disks were the standard for backups, Zip drives offered a remarkable hundredfold increase in capacity using removable cartridges. While hard drives now boast hundreds of gigabytes and beyond, leaving floppies and even Zip disks in the past, Iomega, the company behind the Zip drive, has continued to innovate. Their product line has expanded beyond desktops and into the server room. Iomega, now a part of EMC, a Fortune 500 company specializing in enterprise storage solutions, still caters to individuals and small offices.

item.title: Visa introduces Visa Business Hub to assist small and medium-sized businesses with technology and strategic planning
item.description: Visa has launched the Visa Business Hub, a platform designed to assist small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) in navigating technology and improving their management practices. The hub, initially launched in Singapore and Malaysia, offers software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions that can potentially reduce IT costs by up to 25% through a pay-as-you-use model. This approach minimizes upfront expenses and implementation time. Research indicates that a significant number of businesses in Singapore (80%) view SaaS/cloud adoption as a strategic move rather than a passing trend.

item.title: SAP reported that small and medium-sized enterprises in the Asia-Pacific region have adopted remote work
item.description: A recent study titled “Digital, Resilient, and Experience-driven: How Small and Midsize Organisations Can Prepare for the New Economy,” conducted by SAP in conjunction with Oxford Economics, reveals that small and mid-sized enterprises (SMEs) in the Asia-Pacific region are well-situated to flourish in the evolving business landscape following the COVID-19 pandemic. The study, which surveyed 2,000 senior executives globally, including 832 from APAC countries like Singapore, Australia, and Japan, examined the priorities and digital readiness of SMEs.

item.title: Gigabit Metro Fiber Ethernet Means Business
item.description: By: John Shepler As data-heavy applications consume more bandwidth, businesses are struggling to keep up. Is there a solution, or are companies destined to lose the bandwidth battle? More Bandwidth to the Rescue Today’s business environment demands more bandwidth than ever before. Older technologies like X.25 and T1 lines are no longer sufficient. Even Ethernet over Copper is just a temporary fix. The optimal solution is connecting to the world through fiber optic bandwidth.

item.title: Save the Cell Phone, Save the World
item.description: Cell phones are frequently overlooked as a source of environmental concern, valuable resources, and potential income. While seemingly harmless, these devices contain toxic materials and represent a significant waste problem due to their short lifespans and frequent replacement. A cell phone’s small size and durable exterior might make it seem environmentally benign, but the internal components tell a different story. Lead, cadmium, arsenic, mercury, plastics, and glass are all found within these devices.

item.title: The book guarantees to save presentations from completely missing the mark
item.description: Presentations are a common way to share information, manage projects, and plan, taking up a significant part of the workweek. However, they often waste time and resources. Ed Gruwez, a Belgian communications expert, believes most presentations are ineffective and poorly designed, failing to achieve their goals despite considerable preparation time. He points out their negative impact on corporate decisions and employee satisfaction. Gruwez emphasizes the ubiquity of presentations in professional settings and the significant financial and time resources wasted on ineffective ones.

item.title: Why Alternative Energy Makes Sense for Technology Companies
item.description: The digital world’s dependence on energy is deeply intertwined and may be its downfall, just as energy production’s side effects threaten our physical world. Climate change, for instance, directly impacts the sustainability of Business 2.0. It’s easy to assume that dirty, resource-intensive energy is a relic of the industrial age, replaced by a cleaner information age, especially online. However, the online world can create a false sense of detachment from the physical resources it relies on.

item.title: T1 Lines For MPLS Access
item.description: Companies needing to link numerous locations are increasingly choosing MPLS networks, often finding T1 lines to be the optimal solution for network access. Let’s explore why. Consider an MPLS (Multi Protocol Label Switching) network as a private internet. This private ownership allows the MPLS operator to guarantee the bandwidth and service quality needed for your applications’ reliable operation.
