Crowdonomic, a leading crowdfunding platform in Southeast Asia, was designated as a registered electronic facility by the Securities Commission Malaysia (SC).

item.title: A Singaporean financial technology company is striving to provide improved lending terms for business-to-business transactions
item.description: A Singapore-based fintech startup, Cash-IN-Asia, has introduced a new business-to-business (B2B) lending platform. The company’s fully digital approach lets business owners secure financing directly from their mobile devices. Cash-IN-Asia aims to support micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) in Singapore. The company offers products designed to meet current needs and help these businesses thrive even after the current economic challenges. Their ISO27001-certified platform leverages artificial intelligence (AI) and data analytics to deliver a comprehensive solution for MSMEs seeking transparent and flexible financing.

item.title: Emirates provides LinkedIn Learning courses during flights
item.description: Source: Emirates. Emirates will offer LinkedIn courses inflight. Emirates has teamed up with LinkedIn to offer a selection of LinkedIn Learning courses on its inflight entertainment system, ice. This makes Emirates the first international airline to provide these courses during flights. This new addition to the ice system will launch in November and reflects Emirates’ dedication to offering passengers fresh and diverse entertainment options. The free LinkedIn Learning courses, led by experts, range from 20 minutes to over two hours in length.

item.title: Thailand is gaining traction as a top choice for hosting business events
item.description: Source: TCEB. Thailand, with the Thailand Convention and Exhibition Bureau (TCEB) at the helm, is establishing itself as a prime location for business events. As the Thai government’s primary representative for this sector, TCEB plays a vital role in solidifying Thailand’s leading position in the Asian business events industry and Bangkok’s status as a top-tier destination for international business events. The Thai business events sector is projected to experience robust growth in 2015, anticipating over a million visitors and generating approximately US$3.

item.title: IP Network Cameras for Security
item.description: Most businesses need security cameras. While older models typically provide video output to monitors and recorders, advancements in camera technology now allow for network connectivity. IP or network cameras have a built-in processor and network interface card, enabling access from any location on the network. This means you can use a web browser to view your security camera footage from anywhere globally, providing peace of mind and the ability to respond promptly to incidents.

item.title: Avanta India inaugurates a new office space in Gurgaon
item.description: Avanta Business Centre has established a new premium office space in Gurgaon, India, spanning 25,000 square feet. Conveniently situated near the HUDA City Centre Metro station, the Park Centra facility offers easy accessibility. This marks Avanta’s second business center in Gurgaon. The Park Centra location provides a variety of office sizes, ranging from 77 square feet to approximately 20,000 square feet, to accommodate a diverse clientele. The space is ready for occupancy and features around 300 workstations, a communal area, a pantry, and four meeting rooms.

item.title: The Ethernet Next Door
item.description: Feeling constrained by your internet speed? You’re not alone. While your business might be struggling with a slow T1 line, your competitors may have a secret weapon: a new, affordable broadband service called Carrier Ethernet. This service, rapidly being deployed across the nation, is an extension of the familiar Ethernet standard used in local area networks (LANs). Instead of converting data to different protocols for external connections, businesses can now use Ethernet for seamless, high-speed access to the internet and connections with other facilities.

item.title: The free WooCommerce WordPress plugin has reached 4 million downloads
item.description: WooThemes, a developer of WordPress themes, plugins, and shopping cart features, announced that its WooCommerce WordPress plugin has been downloaded over 4 million times. WooCommerce is WooThemes’ free flagship product, officially partnered with companies like Amazon, Mastercard, and PayPal. Source: WooThemes website. WooCommerce enables businesses to operate e-commerce sites using WordPress as their content management system. WooThemes uses a freemium model. The basic plugin and some add-ons are free, while more advanced extensions and themes require payment.

item.title: Kaspersky provides solutions to combat ransomware
item.description: Ransomware is increasingly targeting businesses, encrypting files and demanding payment for decryption keys. A Kaspersky Lab report reveals a six-fold increase in ransomware attacks against businesses from 2015 to 2016, affecting one in ten business users. Cybercriminals are focusing on businesses, particularly small and medium-sized companies. A Kaspersky Lab and B2B International study found that 42% of respondents from these businesses considered ransomware a major threat. Even brief data unavailability can severely impact small businesses, potentially halting operations entirely.

item.title: Data Center Services For You
item.description: Smaller companies often admire the data centers of larger organizations, but they may not realize that similar services are within their reach. The key is to only own assets crucial to your business and lease the rest, including data center services. You don’t need a massive, secure facility with 24/7 staff, backup generators, and unlimited bandwidth. These services are available on a pay-as-you-go basis. Two types of data centers are eager to accommodate your business.

item.title: International SOS recommends implementing improved risk management strategies for business travel
item.description: International SOS, a company specializing in health and security risk services, emphasizes the growing need for improved risk management for both individual travelers and organizations. Their data reveals a significant rise in travel between the start of 2023 and October 2023, with international travel surging by 59% and domestic travel increasing by 48.4%. These figures align with a recent report from the International Air Transport Association (IATA), which highlights a global travel resurgence.

item.title: Concentrating on Kickstarter: Making Solar Power Accessible to Everyone
item.description: Spor Solar Charges aims to make convenient solar-powered battery charging accessible to everyone. Their product, Spor, is a portable battery charger for USB devices that can recharge itself using solar energy. It can also be powered up using a standard AC outlet. The company claims that Spor can charge multiple devices simultaneously and replenish a phone’s battery almost as quickly as a wall outlet, according to their Kickstarter page. Source: Kickstarter.

item.title: HP believes that the digital printing revolution has the potential to make businesses even more agile
item.description: Source: HP. High-impact retail graphics, floor covering and corrugated display applications printed using HP Latex and Scitex Digital printing technologies at the new HP Graphics Solutions Centre of Excellence in Singapore. The way businesses approach printing is being transformed by commercial digital printing presses. Unlike traditional offset printing, which requires large quantities for cost-effectiveness, digital printers can economically personalize any volume of items, from a single piece to thousands, across diverse materials.

item.title: In 2016, the Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry saw an increase in registered activity
item.description: Source: Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry. Member exports and re-exports reached a value of AED273 billion The Dubai Chamber was involved in 78 events spanning 50 cities The Chamber welcomed 681 delegations representing 81 countries The Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry in the UAE experienced a 9% growth in its member network during 2016, adding 16,800 companies. This brought the organization’s total membership to 201,000 by the year’s end, solidifying its standing as a leading global chamber of commerce in terms of membership.

item.title: Ethernet Port At Your Door
item.description: You might be surprised to learn that a connection to the outside world could be as simple as an Ethernet port in your telecom closet. This is due to a relatively new technology called Ethernet WAN (Wide Area Network). Traditionally, organizations have relied on the public switched telephone network (PSTN) for external connections. Technologies designed for phone calls, like T1, DS3, and SONET fiber optic services, were adapted to carry data traffic and internet access.
